questions.text: A 45-year-old obese male patient presents with these lesions over his neck. What is your diagnosis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Hyperpigmented velvety plaque on neck and groin in a obese individual in known as Acanthosis Nigricans

questions.text: A 30-year-old female presents with these itchy lesions in her both axillae of 1-month duration. What is your most likely diagnosis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Apocrine malaria is also termed as Fox Fordyce disease (FFD).
Age group: 13 - 35 years
Sex predilection: Female to male ratio is 9:1
Pathogenesis: Occlusion of the apocrine duct resulting from the accumulation of keratin in the follicular infundibulum.
Clinical features: 
Primary lesions:  2 -3 mm papules that may be yellow, skin-colored
Sites: Axillary, areolar, perianal, and genital areas.
Treatment options: Topical corticosteroids, topical clindamycin, and topical calcineurin inhibitors

questions.text: Rakesh, a 7 yr old boy had itchy, excoriated papules on the forehead and the exposed parts of the arms and legs for 3 years. Similar history in his sibling. Most likely diagnosis is?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Classical sites on elbow and positive family history favors diagnosis of Atopic dermatitis

choices.text: Giemsa stain of lymph node aspirate

questions.text: A 23 year old male had unprotected sexual intercourse with a commercial sex worker. Two week later, he developed a painless, indurated ulcer on the glans which exuded clear serum on pressure. Inguinal lymph nodes in both groins were enlarged and not tender. The most appropriate diagnostic test?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Painless Ulcer and painless Lymphnode enlargement is a feature of sysphilis. For syphilis we do dark field microscopy

questions.text: 5 days after an unprotected homosexual intercourse a 27 year old male presents with complaints of burning micturition. There is no frank pus but on milking urethra, some discharge was collected. Gram’s stain of the discharge shows multiple gram negative diplococci both within and outside the polymorphs. The diagnosis is:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Short incubation period and presence of Gram negative diplococci on gram’s staining is a feature of Gonococcal urethritis

choices.text: Fusidic acid cream twice daily for 10 days

questions.text: What is the best treatment for the image depicted below
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

This is image of herpes labialis or cold sore or fever blister. The treatment of choice is T. Acyclovir 400mg TDS for 5-7 days

questions.text: Malphigian layer of skin is:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

St. Malpigian is Stratum spinosum & Stratum basale together

questions.text: A 40Y/male present with painful, grouped vesicles over erythematous base along T3 dermatome region. Which of the following would be the most likely causative organism?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

This is image of grouped vesicles on a single dermatome, feature of herpes zoster. This HHV-3 viral infection (Varicella zoster virus)

questions.text: A 2 month old male infant developed otitis media for which he was given a course of cotrimoxazole. A few days later, he developes fever, irritability and skin tenderness followed by extensive peeling of skin. There were no mucosal lesions. The most likely diagnosis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Staphylococcus releases a diffusible toxin which binds to dsg-1 and causes extensive peeling of the skin, but unlikely to drug reaction there is no mucosal lesions

questions.text: Actively growing phase of hair is
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Anagen is an active growth phase. The duration of anagen determine the length of the hairs

questions.text: All of the following are types of Lichen planus except?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Lichen scrofulosorum is a tuberculid, a hypersensitivity reaction to TB bacilli situated deep inside the body. No M TB in skin

questions.text: A sexually active male presented with warts on his penis as shown below. Which of these strains of HPV is most commonly the cause of these lesions?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A)

questions.text: A histopathological image of the skin biopsy of a patient given below is suggestive of:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Pemphigus vulgaris has suprabasal spit

questions.text: What is the most probable diagnosis based on the given image?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

•Nodulo-ulcerative lesion on the inner canthus of eyes, is a feature of basal cell carcinoma. It is most common skin tumor.

questions.text: An 18 years old male presented with pruritus over fingers. The clinical picture of the lesion and the causative agent is given below. What is the most probable diagnosis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Classical interdigital itchy lesions with a image of Scarcoptes scabiei

choices.text: Intercellular deposits of IgG and C3

questions.text: A middle-aged lady presented to the OPD with painful blisters on the skin and oral mucosa. Direct immuno fluorescence was done as shown below. All the following are true about the disease pathogenesis except?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Fish net pattern of intercellular IgG deposit is a feature of Pemphigus. Presence of mucosal lesions indicate that its is Pemphigus Vulgaris. In P. Vulgaris IgG antibodies are directed against dsg3>>>dsg1

questions.text: A factory worker comes to you with itchy, annular scaly plaques in the groin. On prescribing corticosteroid ointment, there is significant relief in pruritus but the lesion continues to extend peripherally. What is the likely diagnosis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Itchy annular lesions, non-responsive to steroids, on groin are tinea cruris

questions.text: A 28-year-old patient of neurocysticercosis develops generalized peeling of skin all over except palms and soles starting one month after taking anti-epileptics. What is the most probable diagnosis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Extensive peeling (BSA>30%) following the intake of drug is Toxic epidermal necrolysis

questions.text: Which of the following causative organism is responsible for this condition?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Angular vesicles on hand, foot, mouth and buttocks are feature of HFMD.

questions.text: A lady came with complaints of a bluish lesion over left side of forehead and left eye. An irregular bluish lesion in left superior conjunctive and forehead is seen. What is the diagnosis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Unilateral Bluish discoloration on the distribution of trigeminal nerve with blue sclera is a feature of  Nevus of OTA. This is due to premature cessation of migration of neural crest cells

questions.text: Which component of cement causes allergic contact dermatitis?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A)

questions.text: A 30 years old male presented with silvery scales on elbow and knee, which bleed on removal. The probable diagnosis is:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

A well-defined erythematous papule or plaque with silvery scales on the extensors are feature of Psoriasis

questions.text: This nail finding is characteristically seen in:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

The extension of proximal nail fold on the nail plate and its fusion with nail bed is feature of Dorsal pterygium. Th most specific nail finding in the patients of Lichen planus

questions.text: A 16-yr. old student with h/o herpatic gingivostomatitis developed generalized and symmetrical rash more over palms and soles, 1-2 cm diameter round patches consisting of 3 concentric rings with a central dusky zone. Rashes burning and pruritic. Few erosive lesions in oral mucosa. What is your diagnosis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

symmetrical rash more over palms and soles, 1-2 cm diameter round patches consisting of 3 concentric rings with a central dusky zone is a feature of Erythema multiforme

questions.text: Defect in epidermolysis bullosa dystrophic is
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B)

questions.text: Papillary tip abscess is a finding seen in
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A)

questions.text: All of the following are characterised by hyperpigmented lesions except?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D)

questions.text: What is the probable diagnosis in a 7 yr old boy from Bihar  with a 7 month history of ill-defined slightly raised atrophic macules on the face?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A)

questions.text: About Pityriasis Rosea which of the following statements is false?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B)

questions.text: What is Max–Joseph space associated with?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B)

questions.text: Patch test is read after
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B)

questions.text: In Miliaria crystallina, obstruction of sweat duct is at the level of
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A)

questions.text: The allergen implicated in Bindi dermatitis is ?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C)

questions.text: A child presents with multiple, discrete, skin-colored, 1- to 3-mm dome-shaped smooth papules on the face with central umbilication. The most likely diagnosis is:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D)

questions.text: A 30 year old male presented to dermatology OPD with complaints of patch of hair loss without scaling, erythema or papulation. The resident noted exclamation mark hair at edges of the patch. Which of the following are the poor prognostic factors of the possible diagnosis?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D)

questions.text: Limpet like cone shaped lesions in Psoriasis refer to?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A)

choices.text: Munro’s micro abscess, fir tree appearance, epidermal hyperplasia
Munro’s micro abscess, parakeratosis, epidermal hyperplasia
Munro’s micro abscess, satellite pustule, epidermal hyperplasia
Munro’s micro abscess, Wickham’s straie, epidermal hyperplasia

questions.text: Which of the following feature are associated with psoriasis?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B)

questions.text: A child came with similar lesion as shown in the picture over elbow and shaft of the penis. What is the diagnosis?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C)

questions.text: Ulcer "with overhanging / undermined edges” in the neck region as shown in the image given below. Diagnosis?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A)

questions.text: Which mineral deficiency can lead to following condition?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A)

questions.text: First line treatment for acne comedones ?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D)

questions.text: Identify the condition shown in the image ?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A)

questions.text: A patient comes with cauliflower growths on foot. He is a farmer by occupation. Scraping shows following. The diagnosis is?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

A farmer comes with cauliflower growths on foot, with brown colour bodies on the biopsy is a feature of chromoblastomycosis

questions.text:
Arrange the following blistering disorders from superficial to deep?

1. Pemphigus vulgaris

2. Bullous pemphigoid

3. Pemphigus foliaceous

4. EB dystrophica
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D)

questions.text: A patient presents with some red/yellow staining axillary hairs. The likely organism causing this is?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

A patient presents with some red/yellow staining axillary hairs, this is a feature of Trichomycosis axillaris. The causative agent is coryn. Tenius

questions.text: Pseudoisomorphic phenomenon is seen in?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Koebner’s phenomena , is the appearance of new skin lesions on previously unaffected skin secondary to trauma
Seen in LP, Psoriasis, Vitiligo, Molluscum, warts

questions.text: Test likely to help in the diagnosis of itchy annular plaques on the face is?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

itchy annular plaques on the face is tinea facie, for which KOH mount is done

choices.text: Burrows are seen in stratum corneum
Itching is more severe at night

questions.text: Not a feature of scabies?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Scabies never presents with fever

questions.text: A patient who is farmer works in maize field have more maize in his food presented with diarrhoea, dementia and some lesions on neck, which amino acid deficiency can lead to the given condition?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Maize is a poor source of tryptophan (precursor of niacin), hence they develop Pellagra (Diarrhoea, dermatitis, dementia)

questions.text: A girl child presented with rough keratotic lesions over her elbow, knee, also had problem in dark vision/night vision. Diagnosis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Night blindness and follicular hyperkeratotic lesions on the elbow, knee and lateral thigh (Phrynoderma) is a feature of Vitamin A deficiency

questions.text: A male child presented with swelling in the scalp for 3 months. He has a dog in the home. Diagnosis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

A child with Painful boggy swelling on scalp with discharging sinuses, scarring alopecia is a classical feature of KERION

choices.text: She is susceptible to  chicken pox

questions.text: A 23 year female, primi gravida, whose nephew is staying in the same house contracted varicella. Patient had no history of past exposure. She visited medical care centre where the varicella antibody test done and found negative?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

the varicella antibody test done and found negative, this means that the pregnant women have never encountered VZV infection in the past and hence she is now susceptible to get Varicella

questions.text: Patient on multidrug therapy for leprosy presented with inflammation on the existing lesions, nerve involvement seen without systemic features. What will be the treatment approach?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

This is an image of Lepra reaction patient. Never stop MDT in these patient. To stop the features of hypersensitivity reaction, these patient are given oral steroids (DOC)

questions.text: Identify the following lesion?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

This is epidermal melanocytic proliferation leading to hyperpigmented plaque on the trunk of an adolescent individual. The plaques is associated thick coarse hairs and acneform eruption

questions.text: Which of the following medicines taken during pregnancy is responsible for the defect seen in the child below?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Isotretinoin (13-cis retinoic acid) is a teratogenic drug. Should be avoided in pregnancy. The most common complication is dryness

questions.text: Name the solid lesion more than 0.5 can in Diameter?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Papule: solid raised lesion lesion of <1cm> 1cm

questions.text: Which of the following cells not present in stratum basale layer?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

The cells in the st. basal layer are keratinocyte, melanocyte, merkel cell. Langerhan cells are seen in St. spinosum

questions.text: Identify the condition?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Target lesion: three concentric rings with central dusky, middle edema and peripheral erythema. Seen in Erythema multiforme

questions.text: A child after taking medicine for fever presented with following picture. Most likely diagnosis of the following is?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Post drug intake presence of targetoid lesions ( 2 concentric rings) in BSA<10% and mucosal lesions (hemorrhagic crusting)

questions.text: A 25 year old girl presented with erythematous papules on the face as shown in the figure. The lesions were exacerbated on excessive sweating, sun exposure and emotional disturbances. What is the diagnosis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

In rosacea post triggers (like emotional disturbances, sunlight, alcohol consumption, smoking) patients develops flushing associated with papules/pustules on the convexity of the face.

questions.text: A 35 yr old male develops purple red oval macule after taking metronidazole. History of similar lesion at the same site six month back. What is your diagnosis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

This is a localized type of drug reaction where the site of rash is fixed. The healing is with pigmentation.

questions.text: A lady came with unilateral white skin lesions with leukotrichia as shown in the picture. What is likely diagnosis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Segmental vitiligo: Depigmented patch u/l on the dermatomal pattern

choices.text: Usually a/w flushing & intolerance to heat and spicy food
The underlying diagnosis is acne conglobate
Oral antibiotics and topical retinoids are the treatment of choice

questions.text: 20 year old male presented to dermatology OPD with multiparous comedones. There is intercommunicating abscess, cyst with serosanguinous fluids or pus. Which of the following statement regarding the underlying condition is true?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B)

choices.text: Oral lesion shows a white lacework like pattern
Wing shaped projection of proximal nail fold onto nail bed, spitting and destroying called pterygium is seen

questions.text: A 50 year old male patient presented to dermatology OPD with violet colored patch on wrist and dorsum of hand. The doctor noticed following characteristic lesions in the patient. Which of the above clinical condition is wrong?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

The image shows the classical violaceous patches of LP. The mucosal white reticulate oral LP and the nails shows dorsal pterygium.
Nikolsky sign is the skin separation on tangential force, seen in the patient with intravascular split

questions.text: A lady presents with a history of burning sensation on eating spicy food. On examination bilateral white lacy streaks are present in buccal mucosa. There is no history of tobacco abuse but amalgamated third molar is present. What is the diagnosis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Presence of mercury containing dental amalgum is a strong triggers for oral LP

questions.text: A 40 year old male presented with the following lesions. Immunofluorescence shows IgG in intercellular space. What can be the most probable diagnosis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Flaccid bulla with mucosal erosion is a classical feature of pemphigus Vulgaris

questions.text: A 35 year old female presented with painful blisters over oral mucosa and genital areas. She gave a history of similar lesion in the past. A biospsy from the lesion showed a suprabasal cleft on histopathology. Immunofluorescence microscopy revealed intercellular IgG deposits as shown below. What is the most likely diagnosis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Flaccid bulla with mucosal erosion is a classical feature of pemphigus Vulgaris. This is a patient of Pemphigus vulgaris. They have IgG against desmolein 3>1, but there is no antibodies against hemidesmosomes

questions.text: A patient came with itchy tense blisters on normal skin as well as over urticarial plaques, as shown in the image. What is the diagnosis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Presence of annular arrangement of vesicles is a classical feature of linear IgA disease (also known as Chronic bullous dermatosis of childhood)

questions.text: A 30 yr old male patient has a large, foul smelling, spreading exuberant ulcer with bright red granulation tissue over the glans penis. There was no lymphadenopathy. The most likely causative organism is?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

An exuberant ulcer with bright red granulation tissue without lymphnode enlargement is a feature of Donovanosis. The causative agent id calymmatobacteria granulomatis/klebshiella granulomatis

questions.text: Diagnosis of a female with hair loss involving crown and frontal scalp with maintenance of frontal hair line:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

In Female Pattern  baldness the loss of hair is seen from crown with intact frontotemporal line

questions.text: Child presents with sores in the mouth and a rash on the hands and feet as shown in the image below. What is the causative organism for it?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Presence of angular vesicles on hands, foot, mouth and buttock is a feature of coxsackie A 16 viral infection. This is known as Hand foot and mouth disease (HFMD)

questions.text: A patient comes with the following lesion on his shoulder and chest. The lesion are scarring in the centre and increasing on the periphery. The most appropriate treatment for this would be?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Annular plaque with activity on the margin and scarring in the center is a feature of cutaneous tb known as Lupus vulgaris

questions.text: A patient with HIV has white plaque on uvula. Pseudohyphae were seen on microscopy. The likely diagnosis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Immunocompromised patient with white pseudomembrane in oral cavity is a feature of oral candidiasis

questions.text: A patient of leprosy presents with painful lesion on arms as shown. He is also febrile. He is given a drug which increases numbness of the hands and feet. The likely diagnosis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Here the Leprosy patient is febrile with painful lesions indicate that he is in leprosy reaction. In Type 2 leprosy reaction thalidomide is considered very effective. The side effect of thalidomide is teratogenicity and peripheral neuropathy

questions.text: A 28 year old boy has asymptomatic dome shaped small lesion on forehead for last 2 months. He has a 2 year old daughter with similar lesion. What is the causative agent?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Dome shape papules with central umbilicated with white cheesy material squeezing out is a feature of molluscum contagiosum. It is Pox virus (DNA virus)

questions.text: A patient presents with following lesions. Investigation show cocci in long chain. The diagnosis is?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Yellowish crusting on the exposed site in a child is a feature of Non bullous impetigo (aka Impetigo contagiosa)

choices.text: Amelanotic skin associated with a white forelock
Islands of normal or hypomelanotic skin

questions.text: Which of the following is untrue regarding piebaldism?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Piebaldism is an autosomal dominant condition. Patient has  amelanotic skin associated with a white forelock. There are islands of normal skin on hypomelanotic

questions.text: Patch test is done to document?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Patch test is investigation of choice for allergic contact dermatitis. This is based on type 4 hypersensitivity reaction.
The patch is removed at 48 hours (Day 2) and read at 96 hours (Day 4)

questions.text: A patient was treated with steroids for psoriasis. On stopping the treatment he develops fever, malaise and lesions as seen in the image below. What is the most probable diagnosis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Systemic corticosteroids are contraindicated in the patients of Psoriasis. The reason is that withdrawal of steroid causes a rebound effect causing exacerbation of the existing lesions. It coverts the stable psoriasis ( chronic plaque psoriasis) to the unstable variety ( Erythrodermic/Pustular)

questions.text: A patient with fever and severe joints pain comes to you. She also developed pigmentation of nose subsequently. The likely diagnosis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Patient with fever and joint pain indicated that he is suffering from chikungunya fever. 2-3 week after this viral infection patients develops a very classical centrofacial pigmentation ( as shown) known as chik sign

questions.text: A young man presents with a rash which was prominent acrally as shown. He also reports hair loss in patches on scalp and some perianal lesions. The likely etiological agent is?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Hyperpigmented macules on palm and sole (macular syphilid), moth eaten alopecia and genital lesion ( condyloma lata) is the feature of secondary syphilis

questions.text: A child scratches his hand with a pen. A red wheal appears which persist for 30 minutes. What would be the diagnosis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Trauma with blunt object causing linear wheals is known as dermographism. This is the most common type of physical urticaria.

questions.text: Which of the following is a specific lesion of acne vulgaris?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Comedone is the classical/pathognomonic lesion of Acne vulgaris. It occurs due to hypercornification of the duct

questions.text: Which of the following is a subepidermal disease?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D)

questions.text: Rarest variety of pemphigus (is)?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

The rarest variety of pemphigus is P. vegetans. These patients present clinically with verrucous thickened growth of the flexors like axilla, groin and intermammary area

questions.text: Which drug is most commonly implicated in drug-induced pemphigus?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Drug induced pemphigus

Due to biochemical interaction of thiol group of drug with the desmoglein
Eg:
Penicillamine (mc)
Iodide
Penicilline
Phenopthalein
Phenytoin
Thiazide diuretic

questions.text: Which among the following is the most common type of  psoriatic arthritis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Around 5-10% of psoriatic patients develops joint involvement. The most common type is asymmetrical oligoarthritis. The joint which is frequently involved is DIP joint

questions.text: Hutchinson’s syphilitic triad includes all except:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Hutchinson’s syphilitic triad is seen in congenital syphilis. This includes Hutchinson’s teeth, interstitial keratitis, deafness.

questions.text: Early eruption of secondary syphilis are all except:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

The secondary syphilis always has asymptomatic lesions, no itching or pain

questions.text: Crystaline miliaria is due to obstruction to:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Obstruction of the duct of eccrine sweat glands is known as miliaria

questions.text: Which of the following Gene when mutated leads to Darier’s disease?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Darier’s disease, also known as Keratosis follicularis. The gene defect is ATP2A2.

questions.text: Which of the following is the commonest association of paraneoplastic pemphigus?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Pemphigus associated with underlying occult/manifest malignancy. The most common malignancy associated is Non-Hodgkin’s lymphoma

questions.text: All of the following infections present with maculopapular rash except?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Shingles/Herpes zoster clinically presents with multiple grouped vesicles associated with pain and burning sensation. The lesion occur in dermatomal pattern

questions.text: Treatment of multibacillary leprosy is?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Multibacillary leprosy patients are given three drugs for 12 months and paucibacillary leprosy patient take three drugs for 6months

questions.text: BP 180 is the target antigen in all of the following autoimmune bullous disease except?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C)

questions.text: What is the treatment for nodulocystic acne vulgaris?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A)

questions.text: Least propensity for lymphatic spread would be?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A)

choices.text: Intercellular deposits of IgG and C3

questions.text: A middle aged lady presented to OPD with painful blisters on the skin and oral mucosa. Direct immunofluorescence was done as shown below. All of the following are true about the disease pathogenesis except?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

This is a patient of Pemphigus vulgaris. They have IgG against desmolein 3>1, but there is no antibodies against hemidesmosomes. They remain intact.

questions.text: An alcoholic patient presents with lesion as shown. He also has diarrhea. Deficiency of what associated with it?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Tryptophan

questions.text: The characteristic microscopic feature of bullous pemphigoid is?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Bullous pemphigoid is an example of subepidermal split. Acantholysis (separation of keratinocyte) is seen in VBD with intradermal split.
